compounddef.title: CKEditor 4 Export to PDF Plugin Changelog

listitem.para: Improved external CSS support for Classic Editor by handling exceptions and displaying convenient error messages.

sect1.title: ckeditor4-plugin-exportpdf 1.0.0
sect1.para: The first stable release of the CKEditor 4 WYSIWYG Editor Export to PDF plugin. After a few months of the beta phase, testing and listening to community feedback, the CKEditor 4 Export to PDF plugin is stable and can be used with full confidence. Enjoy!

listitem.para: Introduced access control mechanism. The plugin now can be configured with additional exportPdf_tokenUrl option to allow commercial use.
Updated Export to PDF plugin npm readme to link to the official plugin documentation.
Renamed the Export to PDF plugin button from exportPdf to ExportPdf. The ExportPdf name should now be used while setting up a custom toolbar with the CKEDITOR.config.toolbar configuration option.

sect1.title: ckeditor4-plugin-exportpdf 0.1.0
sect1.para: The first beta release of the CKEditor 4 Export to PDF plugin.

This plugin allows you to easily print your WYSIWYG editor content to a PDF file. When enabled, this feature sends the content of your editor together with the styles that are used to display it to the CKEditor Cloud Services HTML to PDF converter service. The service then generates a PDF document that can be downloaded by the user.

listitem.para: Exporting HTML content from CKEditor 4 WYSIWYG editor to PDF with a single click.
Setting a custom name for the generated PDF file.
Changing the appearance of the PDF document (like margins, text styling, custom headers and footers etc.) with custom CSS styles.
Pre-processing HTML content via synchronous and asynchronous code before the generation of the PDF file.
